intro: Rubus pinetorum, commonly known as the pine bramble, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in the spring, which are followed by red, edible berries in the summer. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The berries are a food source for various wildlife, including birds and mammals.
